content.text: GRECO--Dr. Gabriel, 91, loving husband of Norma, he passed away on Friday, January 6, in his sleep after a lingering illness. He was a man of infinite wisdom, integrity and great dignity. He was a skilled ophthalmologist and had great compassion. He was on the staffs of Bellevue, Tish Hospital, St. Vincent and Cabrini. He was a warm, loving friend and will be missed by all. Besides his wife, he is survived by his two sisters, Marion Macina and Rosalie Pasquale, and nieces, nephews and cousins. Services will be held Monday & Tuesday at Chas Peter Nagel Funeral home in NYC. In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made to Diabetes Research Institute Foundation.  $(6$)GRECO--Gabriel J. M.D., beloved husband of Norma, devoted brother of Marion Macina and Rosalie Pasquale, survived by many nieces, nephews and many wonderful friends. Reposing at Chas. Peter Nagel Funeral Home, 352 E. 87 St. NYC, between 1st and 2nd Ave. Mass of Christian Bural. St Joseph's Church. 87 St between 1st and York. Wednesday 10AM. Entombment Nassau Knolls Cemetery. Visiting hours, Monday and Tuesday 2-5, 7-9pm.
content.title: Paid Notice: Deaths   GRECO, DR. GABRIEL

content.text: CURLEY--Jane. The partners and staff of Goldfarb & Fleece express our profound sadness on the passing of our good friend and colleague, Jane Curley. We extend our heartfelt condolences to her family. $(6$)CURLEY--Jane. Jack Rudin, the entire Rudin family and all of Rudin Management Company mourn the passing of respected colleague of 17 years and longtime friend, Jane Curley. Our thoughts and prayers are with the Curley family. $(6$)CURLEY--Jane A. suddenly on January 14, 2007. Devoted daughter of the late Robert and Katherine (Murphy). Beloved sister of Robert (Gerry) and Raymond (Tracy). Loving aunt of Amy Doherty (John), Daniel, Kaitlyn, Taylor and Patrick. Great aunt to Jack Doherty. Friends may call at Andrett Funeral Home 353 Second Ave (between 20th and 21st St.). Wednesday and Thursday, 2-5 and 7-9pm. Mass of Christian burial will be celebrated on Friday, 10am at Epiphany R.C. Church. In lieu of flowers donations may be made to Msgr Scanlan High School 915 Hutchinson River Pkwy, Bronx, NY 10465, Jane Curley Scholarship fund.
content.title: Paid Notice: Deaths   CURLEY, JANE

content.text: FEINERMAN--Rabbi Judah. The Yeshiva University/ RIETS family is saddened by the passing of a devoted alumnus who was widely recognized for his leadership on behalf of Jewish education. A past member of the YU Board of Trustees, he also served on the Board of Trustees of the Rabbi Isaac Elchanan Theological Seminary (RIETS) and was its Chair for many years. Heartfelt condolences are extended to his beloved wife, Ruth ''Shepsie'' Feinerman, who, with him, is a YU Guardian; to their children: Elliot (and Carol) Feinerman, Sharon (and Dr. Abraham) Herzberg, Rabbi Rodney (and Raisie) Feinerman, Ira (and Rabbi Sholom) Schlessel; to his sisters: Rickie (and Dr. Irving) Goldstein and Dr. Esther (and Rabbi Dr. Maurice) Wohlgelernter; and to his seventeen grandchildren and four greatgrandchildren. May the entire family be comforted among the mourners of Zion and Jerusalem. Yeshiva University Richard M. Joel, President Dr. Norman Lamm Chancellor Morry J. Weiss, Chair YU Board of Trustees Julius Berman, Chair RIETS Board of Trustees
content.title: Paid Notice: Deaths   FEINERMAN, RABBI JUDAH

Dear mother-in-law of Mary Louise, Angelo and Adeline. content.text: SEDERBAUM--Arthur D. died peacefully at his home in New York City on January 19, surrounded by his beloved wife, Jayne M. Kurzman, daughters, Rebecca and Elizabeth, son David and his wife, Phoenix, sister Caroline Sederbaum and stepchildren, Anthony and Pamela Rykowski. He is also survived by his father, William Sederbaum, of Jacksonville, Florida. A nationally respected trusts and estates attorney, an avid patron of the arts and devoted father and husband, his wisdom, generosity and sense of humor will be greatly missed. Visitation at Frank E. Campbell Funeral Chapel, 81st Street and Madison Avenue, Monday, January 22, 2-5pm and 7-9pm. Funeral at St. Paul's Chapel at Columbia University, 118th Street and Amsterdam Avenue, Tuesday, January 23, 10:30 am. In lieu of flowers, the family asks that donations be made to The Rockefeller University or Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center.
content.title: Paid Notice: Deaths   SEDERBAUM, ARTHUR D.

content.text: WINKLER--Martin. The Officers, Board, and members of Temple Emanu-el of Lynbrook record with great sorrow the death of our beloved past President. We extend heartfelt condolences to his family. Bruce Kerner, President Rabbi Scott Corngold  WINKLER--Martin on January 2nd, 2007. Age 85 of Boca Raton. Formerly of Muttontown, NY. President of Belwin-Mills Music Publishing Corp. for over 40 years. Survived by his wife of 40 years, Kate. Beloved father of five children. Poppa to 14 grandchildren. Great-Poppa to five great-grandchildren. Services to be held on Friday January 5th, at 1pm at Gutterman's Funeral Home, 800 Jericho Tpk. Woodbury. 516 -921-5757.  WINKLER--Marty. Farewell dear friend, you are in our hearts and memories forever. Be at peace. Norma and Joel
content.title: Paid Notice: Deaths   WINKLER, MARTIN

content.text: van HENGEL--Maarten, died peacefully at home with his loving family in Scarborough NY on December 29, 2006. Born in Amsterdam, The Netherlands, on March 29, 1927. Survived by his wife of 55 years, the former Drusilla Drake Riley; his four children and their spouses: Maarten and Claudia van Hengel; Ginny and John Loughlin; Hugh and MaryAnn van Hengel; and Drusilla van Hengel and Joshua Patlak; and his five grandchildren: Peter, Christina, Katherine, Emily, and Riley. Memorial service at Scarborough Presbyterian Church on Saturday January 6, 2007 at 11:30 am. Private interment. Donations may be made in Maarten's memory to Phelps Memorial Hospital, Sleepy Hollow or the Netherlands-America Foundation, New York City. $(6$)van HENGEL--Maarten. The Partners of Brown Brothers Harriman & Co. mourn the passing of their long time friend and Partner, Maarten van Hengel. Maarten joined the Firm in 1950 and spent 56 years making it a better place. His wisdom, wit, and energy will be missed. Our sincerest condolences are sent to his wife Dru and his whole family. For the Partners Michael W. McConnell
content.title: Paid Notice: Deaths   VAN HENGEL, MAARTEN

content.text: SILBERMAN--Dr. Elliot J., 75, passed away on January 24 after more than 4 years of the most courageous and valiant battle with pancreatic cancer. Beloved husband of 40 years to Dr. Rosanne K., devoted dad to Michelle and Dr. Clark Hubbard and Dr. Marc and Amy Silberman. Adored grandpa to Rebecca, Jaclyn, and Max. Loving brother to Barbara Cohan. Cherished Uncle Joey and Dr. Joe to all the children whose smiles he cared for as their pedodontist. His inspiration and gentle goodness will live on in our hearts forever. Services will be held at 1:30pm, January 27 at Congregation Neve Shalom, 250 Grove Avenue, Metuchen, NJ.
content.title: Paid Notice: Deaths   SILBERMAN, DR. ELLIOT J.

content.text: HORNBLASS--Albert. I mourn the untimely passing of Dr. Albert Hornblass. He was a great mentor, colleague and friend. The entire Ophthalmic community will miss his warmth and intellect. Dr. Marc Werner  $(6$)HORNBLASS--Albert, M.D. Lenox Hill Hospital and Manhattan Eye, Ear & Throat Hospital mourn the passing of Dr. Albert Hornblass, a respected member of our staffs for more than 40 years and former Surgeon Director of Ophthalmic Plastic Surgery. An international leader in the field, he was a prolific writer, esteemed lecturer and gifted teacher. We honor the memory of our wonderful colleague and extend our heartfelt condolences to his family. William O. Hiltz, Chairman, Board of Trustees/Directors Gladys George, President and CEO Jack M. Dodick, M.D., Chair, Ophthalmology (MEETH) Stephen Obstbaum, M.D., Chair, Ophthalmology (LHH)  $(6$)HORNBLASS--Albert. The officers, Board of Directors, and staff of UJA-Federation of New York mourn the loss of Albert Hornblass, former board member of UJA-Federation and past president of The Board of Jewish Education of New York, and cherished leader of the Jewish community. We extend our heartfelt condolences to the entire family. Morris W. Offit, President Susan K. Stern, Chair of the Board John S. Ruskay, Exec. V.P. & C.E.O.
content.title: Paid Notice: Deaths   HORNBLASS, ALBERT

content.text: WOLF--Gerald L., of Coral Gables, Florida on January 19, 2007 after a courageous battle against idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis. Son of the late Betty and Max Wolf. Beloved husband and best friend of Harriet (nee Chipurnoi). Father of Monica and Andrew Gaines and Elliot and Melinda Wolf. Grandfather of Lauren and Emily Gaines. Brother of Margit Lowenstein. Graduate of the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania. Member of The Rotary Club of Coral Gables. Former Member of the Senior Advisory Board of Coral Gables. In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made to The Rabbi's Fund at Temple Judea of Coral Gables; Pulmonary Rehabilitation at South Miami Hospital, att: Dr. Rodney Benjamin, or The Miller School of Medicine at the University of Miami, att: Dr. Marilyn Glassberg. Memorial service to be held.

content.text: SCHACHTEL--Dr. Maurice. Died on January 25, 2007, in Rancho Mirage, CA. Born May 24, 1913, in London, England, the family emigrated to the US aboard the ill-fated Lusitania. The family settled in Buffalo, where he spent his childhood. An exceptional student, he attended medical school at John Hopkins and graduated shortly after his 20th birthday. The family later settled in New York where Dr. Schachtel practiced medicine in a career spanning more than 70 years. He maintained a private practice in midtown Manhattan for 60 years and was affiliated with Mt. Sinai Hospital for more than 50 years. Retiring shortly before his 93rd birthday, he has been currently residing in Rancho Mirage with his son Daniel and daughter-in-law Sari, and his three grandchildren, Jonathan, Elliot and Julia. He now joins his mother Jane and father Bernard, as well as siblings Irving, Shirley and Rosalyn, in repose in the family mausoleum at Westchester Hill Cemetery, wife Elizabeth and siblings Hyman, John, and Anita rest elsewhere. Services Friday, 11:30am, February 2nd, at ''The Riverside'' 76th Street and Amsterdam Avenue.  SCHACHTEL--Dr. Maurice Died on January 25, 2007 in Rancho Mirage, CA. Born May 24, 1913 in London, England, the family emigrated to the US aboard the ill-fated Lusitania. The family settled in Buffalo, where he spent his childhood. An exceptional student, he attended medical school at Johns Hopkins and graduated shortly after his 20th birthday. The family later settled in New York where Dr. Schachtel practiced medicine in a career spanning more than 70 years. He maintained a private practice in midtown Manhattan for 60 years and was affiliated with Mt. Sinai Hospital for more than 50 years. Retiring shortly before his 93rd birthday, he has been currently residing in Rancho Mirage with his son Daniel and daughter-in-law Sari, and his three grandchildren, Jonathan, Elliot and Julia. He now joins his mother Jane and father Bernard, as well as siblings Irving, Shirley and Rosalyn, in repose in the family mausoleum at Westchester Hills Cemetery, wife Elizabeth and siblings Hyman, John, and Anita rest elsewhere. Services Friday 11:30 am February 2nd at ''The Riverside'' 76th Street and Amsterdam Avenue.
content.title: Paid Notice: Deaths   SCHACHTEL, DR. MAURICE

content.text: ROSENFIELD--Helen Anna, of Brooklyn, New York, died peacefully on Sunday, January 7, 2007 at the age of 95 . She was predeceased by her husband Harry in 1969. She is survived by her son Stephen Rosenfield and his wife Riva Rosenfield, her daughter Mimi Meyers and husband, Gary Mangus, her four grandchildren, Peter Rosenfield, Jonathan Rosenfield, Joan Meyers, and Gregory Meyers, and her two greatgrandchildren, Hannah Rosenfield and Jessie Rosenfield. Funeral services will be held at 12 pm on Wednesday, January 10, 2007 at the Weinstein - Garlick - Kirshenbau Chapels, 1153 Coney Island Ave., Brooklyn, NY, 11230. Active in progressive political causes, Helen was a spirited and compassionate woman who will be missed by her family and friends. In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made to the ACLU Foundation, 125 Broad Street, New York, NY, 10004.

In lieu of flowers donations can be made to Parkinsons Disease Association and American Heart Association. Reposing Scarpaci Funeral Home, 1401 86th St, Brooklyn. Viewing Sunday and Monday 2-5 and 7-9:30 until Tuesday 9am. Mass at St. Francis Cabrini Church, 9:45am.
content.title: Paid Notice: Deaths   DELLOVA, DR. LOUIS A.

content.text: LEIBLER--Frieda The Officers, Trustees, and members of the Forest Hills Jewish Center mourn the death of Frieda Leibler, beloved mother of our member and past president, Jack Leibler. Our thoughts and prayers are with Jack and Valerie and their family at this painful time. Rabbi Gerald C. Skolnik Cantor Adam Frei Meir Toshav, President  $(6$)LEIBLER--Frieda. Loving wife of the late Charles. Beloved mother of Jack and Valerie, and Sylvia and Leo. Adored and adoring Bomma of Carine and Bruce, Philippe, Jennifer and Daniel, Lauren, Nicole and Jeremy. Cherished sister of Hilda and Berthe. May her memory be for a blessing.
content.title: Paid Notice: Deaths   LEIBLER, FRIEDA

content.text: SANDS--Harry, Ph.D., aged 89 years, died on January 3, beloved husband, father, grandfather, brother, uncle and colleague. He dedicated his life to people through the practice of psychology. He was the former CEO of the Postgraduate Center for Mental Health in NYC to which he devoted his passion and commitment for more than 40 years. He was a boundless inspiration to his family and to the people whose lives he touched. He is survived by his loving wife of 61 years, Helene; son, Jeff, and wife, Lynn, of Celebration, FL; son, Rick, and wife, Colleen, of Abington, PA; grandchildren: Michael, Laura, Kevin, Jessica, and Robbie; brothers, Nat and Al. Services at Riverside Chapels (212-362-6600), 76th St. and Amsterdam Ave. On Friday January 5 at 11:30am; interment to immediately follow; shiva at the family home in NYC. Contributions may be made to the Postgraduate Center for Mental Health, NYC, or the American Psychological Foundation, Washington, D.C.
content.title: Paid Notice: Deaths   SANDS, HARRY, PH.D.

content.text: HIDARY--Mariel. The officers, Board of Directors, and staff of UJA-Federation of New York mourn the tragic loss of Mariel Hidary, beloved daughter of David and Aimee Hidary, treasured leaders of the New York Jewish community whose commitment has fostered a shining example of philanthropic generosity and devotion that has enabled us to enrich the Jewish community worldwide. We extend our heartfelt condolences to David and Aimee, and to the entire family. May they becomforted along with the mourners of Zion and Jerusalem. Morris W. Offit, President Susan K. Stern, Chair of the Board John S. Ruskay, Exec. V.P. & C.E.O. $(6$)HIDARY--Mariel, the Jewish Community Relations Council of New York mourns the tragic passing of Mariel Hidary, daughter of our esteemed Board member, David Hidary. May the family be comforted among the mourners of Zion and Jerusalem. Matthew J. Maryles, Pres Michael S. Miller, Executive Vice President and CEO
content.title: Paid Notice: Deaths   HIDARY, MARIEL
